definition: to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in
to make sb change their ways, opinions etc

sentences.english: Stay on the edge of the world, and goodbye.
sentences.chinese: 停留在世界边缘，与之惜别。

sentences.english: He waited patiently while they said their farewells.
sentences.chinese: 在他们依依惜别的时候，他耐心地等待着。

sentences.english: Offer parting wish to have the time of Happiness with you.
sentences.chinese: 献上依依惜别的祝愿，愿福乐时该与你相伴。

sentences.english: If I am invited), I will go to his farewell party.
sentences.chinese: 如果被邀请，我会参加他的惜别会。

sentences.english: Farewell to the wound leave way, forget her, gin deep and shallow.
sentences.chinese: 惜别伤离方寸乱，忘了临行，酒盏深和浅。

definition: to leave (on a long journey)/to part from sb
to take one's leave/to bid farewell
to bid farewell/to part (usually with little hope of meeting again)
loath to part (idiom); emotionally close and unwilling to separate
to shed tears/to be all in tears
to see someone off/to throw someone a send-off party
see 天下沒有不散的筵席|天下没有不散的筵席[tian1 xia4 mei2 you3 bu4 san4 de5 yan2 xi2]
pinyin: tian1 xia4 mei2 you3 bu4 san4 de5 yan4 xi2
